newsitem.title: THAILAND: Bank of Thailand ready if finance merger collapses.
newsitem.headline: Bank of Thailand ready if finance merger collapses.

text.p: Thailand's deputy central bank governor Jaroong Nookhwun said on Friday the authorities are prepared to contain any damage that the financial sector may face from if there is a collapse in alliance talks between Thai Danu Bank Plc and Finance One Plc.
Jaroong told reporters the Bank of Thailand had tried its best to facilitate the alliance between the two companies, which would be the biggest link-up in the Thai finance industry.
Thai Danu and Finance One were expected to give an update on their talks later on Friday.
Finance Minister Amnuay Viravan said on Friday that the delay in wrapping up the Thai Danu-Finance One talks partly stemmed from problems encountered by auditors assessing the two companies' assets.
The two companies were due to have voted on their alliance in late April but the decision has been postponed several times.
Amnuay said Thai Danu may have to decide to initially acquire shares in Finance One as the first step of their eventual merger.
Jaroong said if the merger talks fail, the central bank may help strengthen Finance One by raising its capital. He did not elaborate.
Finance One, the biggest Thai finance company, has been saddled with a large amount of non-performing loans extended to the troubled Thai property sector.
